sen.j: 尾上 松緑（おのえ しょうろく）は、歌舞伎役者の名跡の一つ。
sen.e: Shoroku ONOE is one of professional names for kabuki actor.

sen.j: 定紋は四ツ輪に抱き柏。
sen.e: Jomon (family crest) is four rings with a pair of Japanese emperor leaves.

sen.j: - 初代尾上松助の俳名であり後に自らの名乗っている。
sen.e: Haimyo (also known as Haimei) (the term originally refers to a pen name as a haiku poet, but it also refers to a kabuki actor's offstage name which can be used officially and privately) of Matsusuke ONOE the first, and Matsusuke himself started to use this name as a professional name.

sen.j: 正式な襲名でなかった事や松緑でなく松録であった事によりとりあげられなかった。
sen.e: This is not counted as a succession to the professional name because it was not made official and both kanji '松緑' and '松録' were used for the name.

sen.j: ほか、幕末から明治始めにかけて、大阪で活躍した尾上松緑（京極屋）、大正から昭和初期に映画で活躍した尾上松緑（尾上松之助門下）がいるが、代数に入らない。
sen.e: Also, there are other Shoroku ONOE including Shoroku ONOE (Kyogokuya) who performed actively in Osaka during the end of Edo period through early Meiji period and Shoroku ONOE (disciple of Matsunosuke ONOE) who acted in films during the Taisho period through early Showa period; however, they are not counted as official successions.

Also, there are other Shoroku ONOE including Shoroku ONOE (Kyogokuya) who performed actively in Osaka during the end of Edo period through early Meiji period and Shoroku ONOE (disciple of Matsunosuke ONOE) who acted in films during the Taisho period through early Showa period; however, they are not counted as official successions.

Also, there are other Shoroku ONOE including Shoroku ONOE (Kyogokuya) who performed actively in Osaka during the end of Edo period through early Meiji period and Shoroku ONOE (disciple of Matsunosuke ONOE) who acted in films during the Taisho period through early Showa period; however, they are not counted as official successions.
